description.narrative: Esm3ni ampliﬁes youth voice and agency, strengthens community media, builds critical thinking skills while producing and disseminating positive alternative narratives and youth-led media content. In a whole-of-community approach, the project engages community leaders, building the capacity of educators, local government institutions, and civil society to engage and to act as positive mentors to youth-led media projects. By building students’ media production skills and providing them with practical media experience, the program increases youth job-readiness and opens new employment opportunities. Esm3ni is funded by the ministry of foriegn affairs of the Netherlands. IREX will implement the program in partnership with a public university and a national NGO.

recipient-country.narrative: Esma'ni program is targeting young jordanians aged between 18-24. Mainly residing in Irbid city. But will also target young people from middle region such as Amman, Zarqa, Salt and Sabahb

sector.narrative: ESM3NI builds capacities of Youth to be more conscientious consumers of information and creators of vibrant information. This quarter youth were able to produce 5 radio programs, 6 episodes each. Programs tackle violent extremism through highlighting its pull & push factors.

ESM3NI builds the capacities of a state university (Yarmouk university), by provisioning of highly needed equipment, building capacities of young volunteers (aged between 18-24), and trainning of faculty members on facilitation skills using Esma'ni curricula.

ESM3NI's overall objective is : Jordanian youth are more empowered & resilient to propaganda. Youth engaged in discussions realted to their own community issues, that motivated them to deal with diversity in a more positive manner.In addition, this quarter Esma'ni established a partnership with Jordanian civil society organization the Jordan Hashemite Fund for Human Development (JOHUD).

title.narrative: Esma'ni programs evaluation and comparison with the baseline results

description.narrative: To assess the quality of the programs produced by the Esma'ni students, IREX engaged 15 members of Yarmouk FM Listeners Club and trained them on IREX’s Media Content Analysis Tool (MCAT), which they used during the previous quarter to assess the current programs on Yarmouk FM. This quarter the Listeners Club used MCAT to assess four programs produced by the Esma'ni youth.

title.narrative: Yarmouk FM Programs content quality baseline comparison with programs produced by Esma'ni

description.narrative: assessed in terms of: relevance, objectivity, creativity, accuracy and technical proficiency.with 5 points for each, the average score is out of 25.

comment.narrative: The average of four of the Esma'ni programs assessed is 16.70 out of 25, which is higher than the baseline of the current Yarmouk FM programs which was 12.46.
The target was to achieve a 10% increase from the baseline result
The percentage increase in the MCAT results between the baseline and the Esma'ni programs was 34.03%.
